intro: Cheiridopsis graessneri, commonly known as the Karoo ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the winter months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. Cheiridopsis graessneri is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
